revised_title: Inoculation Preventive and the Discovery of Viruses
tldr: Dr. E. Roux discusses the history and development of preventive inoculations, focusing on Louis Pasteur's work with viruses and the process of attenuation. He explains how viruses are living organisms that can be cultured outside the host and how modifying their culture conditions can lead to the creation of attenuated viruses for preventive inoculations.
